intro: Loranthus mariquitensis, commonly known as the Philippine mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees in the Philippines. It belongs to the Santalaceae family and relies on its host for water and minerals while producing its own carbohydrates through photosynthesis. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its berries are typically red or black and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to the biodiversity of forest ecosystems.
